intro: Melicope leptococca, commonly known as the narrow-leaved melicope, is a member of the Rutaceae family, native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, containing a single seed. Melicope leptococca is often found in lowland and hill forest habitats, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and potential medicinal applications.
